[{"internalType":"address","name":"asset_","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"maxMintPerBatch_","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"maxBurnPerBatch_","type":"uint256"}],"name":"setAssetBatchLimits","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"asset","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint16","name":"hurdleRate","type":"uint16"}],"name":"setHurdleRate","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"paused_","type":"bool"}],"name":"setPaused","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"id","type":"bytes32"},{"internalType":"address","name":"contractAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"setSingletonContract","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"treasury_","type":"address"}],"name":"setTreasury","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"transferOwnership","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"newImplementation","type":"address"},{"internalType":"bytes","name":"data","type":"bytes"}],"name":"upgradeToAndCall","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"stateMutability":"payable","type":"receive"}],"devdoc":{"details":"This contract serves as the protocol's backbone for configuration management and access control. It provides five critical functions: (1) Singleton contract management - registers and tracks core protocol contracts like kMinter and kAssetRouter ensuring single source of truth, (2) Asset and kToken management - handles asset whitelisting, kToken deployment, and maintains bidirectional mappings between underlying assets and their corresponding kTokens, (3) Vault registry - manages vault registration, classification (DN, ALPHA, BETA, etc.), and routing logic to direct assets to appropriate vaults based on type and strategy, (4) Role-based access control - implements a hierarchical permission system with ADMIN, EMERGENCY_ADMIN, GUARDIAN, RELAYER, INSTITUTION, and VENDOR roles to enforce protocol security, (5) Adapter management - registers and tracks external protocol adapters per vault enabling yield strategy integrations. The registry uses upgradeable architecture with UUPS pattern and ERC-7201 namespaced storage to ensure future extensibility while maintaining state consistency.","errors":{"AlreadyInitialized()":[{"details":"Cannot double-initialize."}],"InvalidInitialization()":[{"details":"The contract is already initialized."}],"NewOwnerIsZeroAddress()":[{"details":"The `newOwner` cannot be the zero address."}],"NoHandoverRequest()":[{"details":"The `pendingOwner` does not have a valid handover request."}],"NotInitializing()":[{"details":"The contract is not initializing."}],"Unauthorized()":[{"details":"The caller is not authorized to call the function."}],"UnauthorizedCallContext()":[{"details":"The call is from an unauthorized call context."}],"UpgradeFailed()":[{"details":"The upgrade failed."}]},"events":{"AdapterRegistered(address,address,address)":{"params":{"adapter":"The adapter contract address","asset":"The asset of the vault","vault":"The vault receiving the adapter"}},"AdapterRemoved(address,address,address)":{"params":{"adapter":"The adapter being removed","asset":"The asset of the vault","vault":"The vault losing the adapter"}},"AssetRegistered(address,address)":{"params":{"asset":"The underlying asset address","kToken":"The corresponding kToken address"}},"AssetSupported(address)":{"params":{"asset":"The newly supported asset address"}},"HurdleRateSet(address,uint16)":{"params":{"asset":"The asset receiving the hurdle rate","hurdleRate":"The hurdle rate in basis points"}},"Initialized(uint64)":{"details":"Triggered when the contract has been initialized."},"KTokenDeployed(address,string,string,uint8)":{"params":{"decimals_":"The kToken decimals (matches underlying)","kTokenContract":"The deployed kToken address","name_":"The kToken name","symbol_":"The kToken symbol"}},"KTokenImplementationSet(address)":{"params":{"implementation":"The new implementation address"}},"OwnershipHandoverCanceled(address)":{"details":"The ownership handover to `pendingOwner` has been canceled."},"OwnershipHandoverRequested(address)":{"details":"An ownership handover to `pendingOwner` has been requested."},"OwnershipTransferred(address,address)":{"details":"The ownership is transferred from `oldOwner` to `newOwner`. This event is intentionally kept the same as OpenZeppelin's Ownable to be compatible with indexers and [EIP-173](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-173), despite it not being as lightweight as a single argument event."},"Paused(bool)":{"details":"This event signals a critical protocol state change that affects all inheriting contracts. When paused=true, protocol operations are halted to prevent potential exploits or manage emergencies. Only emergency admins can trigger this, providing rapid response capability during security incidents.","params":{"paused_":"The new pause state (true = operations halted, false = normal operation)"}},"RescuedAssets(address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount rescued","asset":"The rescued asset address","to":"The recipient address"}},"RescuedETH(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of ETH rescued","asset":"The recipient address (asset field for consistency)"}},"RolesUpdated(address,uint256)":{"details":"The `user`'s roles is updated to `roles`. Each bit of `roles` represents whether the role is set."},"SingletonContractSet(bytes32,address)":{"params":{"contractAddress":"The address of the registered singleton contract","id":"The unique identifier for the contract (e.g., K_MINTER, K_ASSET_ROUTER)"}},"TreasurySet(address)":{"params":{"treasury":"The new treasury address"}},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the proxy's implementation is upgraded."},"VaultRegistered(address,address,uint8)":{"params":{"asset":"The underlying asset the vault manages","vault":"The vault contract address","vaultType":"The classification type of the vault"}},"VaultRemoved(address)":{"params":{"vault":"The vault contract address being removed"}},"VaultTargetSelectorRegistered(address,address,bytes4)":{"params":{"selector":"The function selector being allowed","target":"The target contract address","vault":"The vault receiving the permission"}},"VaultTargetSelectorRemoved(address,address,bytes4)":{"params":{"selector":"The function selector being removed","target":"The target contract address","vault":"The vault losing the permission"}}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"addFunction(bytes4,address,bool)":{"details":"Only callable by admin role","params":{"forceOverride":"If true, allows overwriting existing mappings","implementation":"The implementation contract address","selector":"The function selector to add"}},"addFunctions(bytes4[],address,bool)":{"details":"Only callable by admin role","params":{"forceOverride":"If true, allows overwriting existing mappings","implementation":"The implementation contract address","selectors":"Array of function selectors to add"}},"assetToKToken(address)":{"details":"Critical for minting/redemption operations. Reverts if no kToken exists.","params":{"asset":"The underlying asset address"},"returns":{"_0":"The corresponding kToken address"}},"cancelOwnershipHandover()":{"details":"Cancels the two-step ownership handover to the caller, if any."},"completeOwnershipHandover(address)":{"details":"Allows the owner to complete the two-step ownership handover to `pendingOwner`. Reverts if there is no existing ownership handover requested by `pendingOwner`."},"contractName()":{"details":"Used for contract identification and logging purposes. The name should be consistent across all versions of the same contract type. This enables external systems and other contracts to identify the contract's purpose and role within the protocol ecosystem.","returns":{"_0":"The contract name as a string (e.g., \"kMinter\", \"kAssetRouter\", \"kRegistry\")"}},"contractVersion()":{"details":"Used for upgrade management and compatibility checking within the protocol. The version string should follow semantic versioning (e.g., \"1.0.0\") to clearly indicate major, minor, and patch updates. This enables the protocol governance and monitoring systems to track deployed versions and ensure compatibility between interacting components.","returns":{"_0":"The contract version as a string following semantic versioning (e.g., \"1.0.0\")"}},"getAdapter(address,address)":{"details":"Returns external protocol integration enabling yield strategies. Reverts if no adapter is set.","params":{"asset":"The underlying asset of the vault","vault":"The vault address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"The adapter address for the vault-asset pair"}},"getAllAssets()":{"details":"Returns the complete whitelist of supported underlying assets.","returns":{"_0":"Array of all supported asset addresses"}},"getAllVaults()":{"details":"Returns array of all vault addresses that have been registered through registerVault(). Includes both active and inactive vaults. Used for protocol monitoring and management operations.","returns":{"_0":"Array of all registered vault addresses"}},"getContractById(bytes32)":{"details":"Reverts if contract not registered. Used for protocol contract discovery.","params":{"id":"Contract identifier (e.g., K_MINTER, K_ASSET_ROUTER)"},"returns":{"_0":"The contract address"}},"getCoreContracts()":{"details":"Optimized getter for frequently accessed contracts. Reverts if either not set.","returns":{"_0":"The kMinter contract address","_1":"The kAssetRouter contract address"}},"getHurdleRate(address)":{"params":{"asset":"The asset address"},"returns":{"_0":"The hurdle rate in basis points"}},"getMaxBurnPerBatch(address)":{"details":"Used to enforce redemption limits for liquidity and risk management. Reverts if asset not registered.","params":{"asset":"The asset address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"The maximum redeem amount per batch"}},"getMaxMintPerBatch(address)":{"details":"Used to enforce minting limits for liquidity and risk management. Reverts if asset not registered.","params":{"asset":"The asset address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"The maximum mint amount per batch"}},"getTreasury()":{"details":"Treasury receives protocol fees and serves as emergency fund holder.","returns":{"_0":"The treasury address"}},"getVaultAssets(address)":{"details":"Most vaults manage single asset, some (like kMinter) handle multiple.","params":{"vault":"The vault address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"Array of asset addresses the vault manages"}},"getVaultByAssetAndType(address,uint8)":{"details":"Used for routing operations to the appropriate vault. Reverts if not found.","params":{"asset":"The asset address","vaultType":"The vault type classification"},"returns":{"_0":"The vault address for the asset-type pair"}},"getVaultType(address)":{"details":"Returns the VaultType enum value for routing and strategy selection.","params":{"vault":"The vault address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"The vault's type classification"}},"getVaultsByAsset(address)":{"details":"Enables discovery of all vaults capable of handling an asset across different types.","params":{"asset":"Asset address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"Array of vault addresses supporting the asset"}},"grantInstitutionRole(address)":{"details":"Only callable by VENDOR_ROLE. Institutions gain access to kMinter and other premium features.","params":{"institution_":"The address to grant institution privileges"}},"grantManagerRole(address)":{"details":"Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Managers can execute calls in the vault adapter.","params":{"manager_":"The address to grant manager privileges"}},"grantRelayerRole(address)":{"details":"Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Relayers manage external vaults and set hurdle rates.","params":{"relayer_":"The address to grant relayer privileges"}},"grantRoles(address,uint256)":{"details":"Allows the owner to grant `user` `roles`. If the `user` already has a role, then it will be an no-op for the role."},"grantVendorRole(address)":{"details":"Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Vendors can grant institution roles and manage vendor vaults.","params":{"vendor_":"The address to grant vendor privileges"}},"hasAllRoles(address,uint256)":{"details":"Returns whether `user` has all of `roles`."},"hasAnyRole(address,uint256)":{"details":"Returns whether `user` has any of `roles`."},"initialize(address,address,address,address,address,address)":{"params":{"admin_":"Admin role recipient","emergencyAdmin_":"Emergency admin role recipient","guardian_":"Guardian role recipient","owner_":"Contract owner address","relayer_":"Relayer role recipient","treasury_":"Treasury address"}},"isAdapterRegistered(address,address,address)":{"details":"Used to validate adapter-vault relationships before operations.","params":{"adapter":"The adapter address to verify","asset":"The underlying asset of the vault","vault":"The vault address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if adapter is registered for the vault"}},"isAdmin(address)":{"details":"Admin role has broad protocol management capabilities.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has ADMIN_ROLE"}},"isAsset(address)":{"details":"Used for validation before operations. Checks supportedAssets set membership.","params":{"asset":"The asset address to verify"},"returns":{"_0":"True if asset is in the protocol whitelist"}},"isEmergencyAdmin(address)":{"details":"Emergency admin can perform critical safety operations.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has EMERGENCY_ADMIN_ROLE"}},"isGuardian(address)":{"details":"Guardian acts as circuit breaker for settlement proposals.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has GUARDIAN_ROLE"}},"isInstitution(address)":{"details":"Institutions have access to privileged operations like kMinter.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has INSTITUTION_ROLE"}},"isManager(address)":{"details":"Managers can execute calls in the vault adapter.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has MANAGER_ROLE"}},"isRelayer(address)":{"details":"Relayer manages external vault operations and hurdle rates.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has RELAYER_ROLE"}},"isVault(address)":{"details":"Used for validation before vault operations. Checks allVaults set membership.","params":{"vault":"The vault address to verify"},"returns":{"_0":"True if vault is registered"}},"isVendor(address)":{"details":"Vendors can grant institution roles and manage vendor vaults.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has VENDOR_ROLE"}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the owner of the contract."},"ownershipHandoverExpiresAt(address)":{"details":"Returns the expiry timestamp for the two-step ownership handover to `pendingOwner`."},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Returns the storage slot used by the implementation, as specified in [ERC1822](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1822). Note: The `notDelegated` modifier prevents accidental upgrades to an implementation that is a proxy contract."},"registerAdapter(address,address,address)":{"details":"Enables yield strategy integrations through external DeFi protocols. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE.","params":{"adapter":"The adapter contract address","asset":"The vault underlying asset","vault":"The vault address receiving the adapter"}},"registerAsset(string,string,address,bytes32,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"This function performs critical asset onboarding: (1) Validates the asset isn't already registered, (2) Adds asset to the supported set and singleton registry, (3) Deploys a new kToken contract with matching decimals, (4) Establishes bidirectional asset-kToken mapping, (5) Grants minting privileges to kMinter. The function automatically inherits decimals from the underlying asset for consistency. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to maintain protocol security and prevent unauthorized token creation.","params":{"asset":"The underlying asset contract address to register","id":"The unique identifier for singleton asset storage (e.g., USDC, WBTC)","maxBurnPerBatch":"Maximum amount of the asset that can be redeemed in a single batch","maxMintPerBatch":"Maximum amount of the asset that can be minted in a single batch","name":"The name for the kToken (e.g., \"KAM USDC\")","symbol":"The symbol for the kToken (e.g., \"kUSDC\")"},"returns":{"_0":"The deployed kToken contract address"}},"registerVault(address,uint8,address)":{"details":"This function integrates vaults into the protocol by: (1) Validating the vault isn't already registered, (2) Verifying the asset is supported by the protocol, (3) Classifying the vault by type for routing, (4) Establishing vault-asset relationships for both forward and reverse lookups, (5) Setting as primary vault for the asset-type combination if it's the first registered. The vault type determines routing logic and strategy selection (DN for institutional, ALPHA/BETA for different risk profiles). Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to ensure proper vault vetting and integration.","params":{"asset":"The underlying asset address this vault will manage","type_":"The vault classification type (DN, ALPHA, BETA, etc.) determining its role","vault":"The vault contract address to register"}},"removeAdapter(address,address,address)":{"details":"This disables a specific external protocol integration for the vault. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to ensure proper risk assessment before removing yield strategies.","params":{"adapter":"The adapter address to remove","asset":"The vault underlying asset","vault":"The vault address to remove the adapter from"}},"removeFunction(bytes4)":{"details":"Only callable by admin role","params":{"selector":"The function selector to remove"}},"removeFunctions(bytes4[])":{"params":{"selectors":"Array of function selectors to remove"}},"removeVault(address)":{"details":"This function deregisters a vault, removing it from the active vault set. This operation should be used carefully as it affects routing and asset management. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to ensure proper decommissioning procedures are followed. Note that this doesn't clear all vault mappings for gas efficiency.","params":{"vault":"The vault contract address to remove from the registry"}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Allows the owner to renounce their ownership."},"renounceRoles(uint256)":{"details":"Allow the caller to remove their own roles. If the caller does not have a role, then it will be an no-op for the role."},"requestOwnershipHandover()":{"details":"Request a two-step ownership handover to the caller. The request will automatically expire in 48 hours (172800 seconds) by default."},"rescueAssets(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"This function provides a recovery mechanism for assets mistakenly sent to the registry. It includes critical safety checks: (1) Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to prevent unauthorized access, (2) Cannot rescue registered protocol assets to prevent draining legitimate funds, (3) Validates amounts and balances. For ETH rescue, use address(0) as the asset parameter. The function ensures protocol integrity by preventing rescue of assets that are part of normal protocol operations.","params":{"amount_":"The amount of assets to rescue (must not exceed contract balance)","asset_":"The asset address to rescue (use address(0) for ETH)","to_":"The destination address that will receive the rescued assets"}},"revokeRoles(address,uint256)":{"details":"Allows the owner to remove `user` `roles`. If the `user` does not have a role, then it will be an no-op for the role."},"rolesOf(address)":{"details":"Returns the roles of `user`."},"setAssetBatchLimits(address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Helps manage liquidity and risk for high-volume assets.","params":{"asset":"The asset address to set limits for","maxBurnPerBatch_":"Maximum amount of the asset that can be redeemed in a single batch","maxMintPerBatch_":"Maximum amount of the asset that can be minted in a single batch"}},"setHurdleRate(address,uint16)":{"details":"Only relayer can set hurdle rates (performance thresholds). Ensures hurdle rate doesn't exceed 100%. Asset must be registered before setting hurdle rate. Sets minimum performance threshold for yield distribution.","params":{"asset":"The asset address to set hurdle rate for","hurdleRate":"The hurdle rate in basis points (100 = 1%)"}},"setPaused(bool)":{"details":"This function provides critical risk management capability by allowing emergency admins to halt contract operations during security incidents or market anomalies. The pause mechanism: (1) Affects all state-changing operations in inheriting contracts that check _isPaused(), (2) Does not affect view/pure functions ensuring protocol state remains readable, (3) Enables rapid response to potential exploits by halting operations protocol-wide, (4) Requires emergency admin role ensuring only authorized governance can trigger pauses. Inheriting contracts should check _isPaused() modifier in critical functions to respect the pause state. The external visibility with role check prevents unauthorized pause manipulation.","params":{"paused_":"The desired pause state (true = halt operations, false = resume normal operation)"}},"setSingletonContract(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Ensures single source of truth for protocol contracts.","params":{"contractAddress":"Address of the singleton contract","id":"Unique contract identifier (e.g., K_MINTER, K_ASSET_ROUTER)"}},"setTreasury(address)":{"details":"Treasury receives protocol fees and serves as emergency fund holder. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE.","params":{"treasury_":"The new treasury address"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Allows the owner to transfer the ownership to `newOwner`."},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"details":"Upgrades the proxy's implementation to `newImplementation`. Emits a {Upgraded} event. Note: Passing in empty `data` skips the delegatecall to `newImplementation`."}},"title":"kRegistry","version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"AdapterRegistered(address,address,address)":{"notice":"Emitted when an adapter is registered for a vault"},"AdapterRemoved(address,address,address)":{"notice":"Emitted when an adapter is removed from a vault"},"AssetRegistered(address,address)":{"notice":"Emitted when an asset and its kToken are registered"},"AssetSupported(address)":{"notice":"Emitted when an asset is added to the supported set"},"HurdleRateSet(address,uint16)":{"notice":"Emitted when a hurdle rate is set for an asset"},"KTokenDeployed(address,string,string,uint8)":{"notice":"Emitted when a new kToken is deployed"},"KTokenImplementationSet(address)":{"notice":"Emitted when the kToken params.forceOverride: If true, allows overwriting existing mappings
If true, allows overwriting existing mappings
params.selectors: Array of function selectors to add

assetToKToken(address).details: Critical for minting/redemption operations. Reverts if no kToken exists.

cancelOwnershipHandover().details: Cancels the two-step ownership handover to the caller, if any.

completeOwnershipHandover(address).details: Allows the owner to complete the two-step ownership handover to `pendingOwner`. Reverts if there is no existing ownership handover requested by `pendingOwner`.

contractName().details: Used for contract identification and logging purposes. The name should be consistent across all versions of the same contract type. This enables external systems and other contracts to identify the contract's purpose and role within the protocol ecosystem.

returns._0: The contract name as a string (e.g., "kMinter", "kAssetRouter", "kRegistry")

contractVersion().details: Used for upgrade management and compatibility checking within the protocol. The version string should follow semantic versioning (e.g., "1.0.0") to clearly indicate major, minor, and patch updates. This enables the protocol governance and monitoring systems to track deployed versions and ensure compatibility between interacting components.

returns._0: The contract version as a string following semantic versioning (e.g., "1.0.0")

getAdapter(address,address).details: Returns external protocol integration enabling yield strategies. Reverts if no adapter is set.

params.asset: The underlying asset of the vault

returns._0: The adapter address for the vault-asset pair

getAllAssets().details: Returns the complete whitelist of supported underlying assets.

returns._0: Array of all supported asset addresses

getAllVaults().details: Returns array of all vault addresses that have been registered through registerVault(). Includes both active and inactive vaults. Used for protocol monitoring and management operations.

returns._0: Array of all registered vault addresses

getContractById(bytes32).details: Reverts if contract not registered. Used for protocol contract discovery.

getCoreContracts().details: Optimized getter for frequently accessed contracts. Reverts if either not set.

returns._0: The hurdle rate in basis points

getMaxBurnPerBatch(address).details: Used to enforce redemption limits for liquidity and risk management. Reverts if asset not registered.

returns._0: The maximum redeem amount per batch

getMaxMintPerBatch(address).details: Used to enforce minting limits for liquidity and risk management. Reverts if asset not registered.

returns._0: The maximum mint amount per batch

getTreasury().details: Treasury receives protocol fees and serves as emergency fund holder.

getVaultAssets(address).details: Most vaults manage single asset, some (like kMinter) handle multiple.

returns._0: Array of asset addresses the vault manages

getVaultByAssetAndType(address,uint8).details: Used for routing operations to the appropriate vault. Reverts if not found.

returns._0: The vault address for the asset-type pair

getVaultType(address).details: Returns the VaultType enum value for routing and strategy selection.

getVaultsByAsset(address).details: Enables discovery of all vaults capable of handling an asset across different types.

returns._0: Array of vault addresses supporting the asset

grantInstitutionRole(address).details: Only callable by VENDOR_ROLE. Institutions gain access to kMinter and other premium features.

params.institution_: The address to grant institution privileges

grantManagerRole(address).details: Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Managers can execute calls in the vault adapter.

params.manager_: The address to grant manager privileges

grantRelayerRole(address).details: Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Relayers manage external vaults and set hurdle rates.

params.relayer_: The address to grant relayer privileges

grantRoles(address,uint256).details: Allows the owner to grant `user` `roles`. If the `user` already has a role, then it will be an no-op for the role.

grantVendorRole(address).details: Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Vendors can grant institution roles and manage vendor vaults.

params.vendor_: The address to grant vendor privileges

isAdapterRegistered(address,address,addr.details: Used to validate adapter-vault relationships before operations.

params.asset: The underlying asset of the vault

returns._0: True if adapter is registered for the vault

isAdmin(address).details: Admin role has broad protocol management capabilities.

isAsset(address).details: Used for validation before operations. Checks supportedAssets set membership.

returns._0: True if asset is in the protocol whitelist

isEmergencyAdmin(address).details: Emergency admin can perform critical safety operations.

isGuardian(address).details: Guardian acts as circuit breaker for settlement proposals.

isInstitution(address).details: Institutions have access to privileged operations like kMinter.

isManager(address).details: Managers can execute calls in the vault adapter.

isRelayer(address).details: Relayer manages external vault operations and hurdle rates.

isVault(address).details: Used for validation before vault operations. Checks allVaults set membership.

isVendor(address).details: Vendors can grant institution roles and manage vendor vaults.

owner().details: Returns the owner of the contract.

ownershipHandoverExpiresAt(address).details: Returns the expiry timestamp for the two-step ownership handover to `pendingOwner`.

proxiableUUID().details: Returns the storage slot used by the implementation, as specified in [ERC1822](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1822). Note: The `notDelegated` modifier prevents accidental upgrades to an implementation that is a proxy contract.

registerAdapter(address,address,address).details: Enables yield strategy integrations through external DeFi protocols. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE.

params.vault: The vault address receiving the adapter

registerAsset(string,string,address,byte.details: This function performs critical asset onboarding: (1) Validates the asset isn't already registered, (2) Adds asset to the supported set and singleton registry, (3) Deploys a new kToken contract with matching decimals, (4) Establishes bidirectional asset-kToken mapping, (5) Grants minting privileges to kMinter. The function automatically inherits decimals from the underlying asset for consistency. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to maintain protocol security and prevent unauthorized token creation.

params.asset: The underlying asset contract address to register
params.id: The unique identifier for singleton asset storage (e.g., USDC, WBTC)
params.maxBurnPerBatch: Maximum amount of the asset that can be redeemed in a single batch
params.maxMintPerBatch: Maximum amount of the asset that can be minted in a single batch
params.name: The name for the kToken (e.g., "KAM USDC")

registerVault(address,uint8,address).details: This function integrates vaults into the protocol by: (1) Validating the vault isn't already registered, (2) Verifying the asset is supported by the protocol, (3) Classifying the vault by type for routing, (4) Establishing vault-asset relationships for both forward and reverse lookups, (5) Setting as primary vault for the asset-type combination if it's the first registered. The vault type determines routing logic and strategy selection (DN for institutional, ALPHA/BETA for different risk profiles). Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to ensure proper vault vetting and integration.

params.asset: The underlying asset address this vault will manage
params.type_: The vault classification type (DN, ALPHA, BETA, etc.) determining its role
params.vault: The vault contract address to register

removeAdapter(address,address,address).details: This disables a specific external protocol integration for the vault. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to ensure proper risk assessment before removing yield strategies.

params.vault: The vault address to remove the adapter from

params.selectors: Array of function selectors to remove

removeVault(address).details: This function deregisters a vault, removing it from the active vault set. This operation should be used carefully as it affects routing and asset management. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to ensure proper decommissioning procedures are followed. Note that this doesn't clear all vault mappings for gas efficiency.

params.vault: The vault contract address to remove from the registry

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the owner to renounce their ownership.

renounceRoles(uint256).details: Allow the caller to remove their own roles. If the caller does not have a role, then it will be an no-op for the role.

requestOwnershipHandover().details: Request a two-step ownership handover to the caller. The request will automatically expire in 48 hours (172800 seconds) by default.

rescueAssets(address,address,uint256).details: This function provides a recovery mechanism for assets mistakenly sent to the registry. It includes critical safety checks: (1) Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to prevent unauthorized access, (2) Cannot rescue registered protocol assets to prevent draining legitimate funds, (3) Validates amounts and balances. For ETH rescue, use address(0) as the asset parameter. The function ensures protocol integrity by preventing rescue of assets that are part of normal protocol operations.

params.amount_: The amount of assets to rescue (must not exceed contract balance)
params.asset_: The asset address to rescue (use address(0) for ETH)
params.to_: The destination address that will receive the rescued assets

revokeRoles(address,uint256).details: Allows the owner to remove `user` `roles`. If the `user` does not have a role, then it will be an no-op for the role.

setAssetBatchLimits(address,uint256,uint.details: Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Helps manage liquidity and risk for high-volume assets.

params.asset: The asset address to set limits for
params.maxBurnPerBatch_: Maximum amount of the asset that can be redeemed in a single batch
params.maxMintPerBatch_: Maximum amount of the asset that can be minted in a single batch

setHurdleRate(address,uint16).details: Only relayer can set hurdle rates (performance thresholds). Ensures hurdle rate doesn't exceed 100%. Asset must be registered before setting hurdle rate. Sets minimum performance threshold for yield distribution.

params.asset: The asset address to set hurdle rate for
params.hurdleRate: The hurdle rate in basis points (100 = 1%)

setPaused(bool).details: This function provides critical risk management capability by allowing emergency admins to halt contract operations during security incidents or market anomalies. The pause mechanism: (1) Affects all state-changing operations in inheriting contracts that check _isPaused(), (2) Does not affect view/pure functions ensuring protocol state remains readable, (3) Enables rapid response to potential exploits by halting operations protocol-wide, (4) Requires emergency admin role ensuring only authorized governance can trigger pauses. Inheriting contracts should check _isPaused() modifier in critical functions to respect the pause state. The external visibility with role check prevents unauthorized pause manipulation.

params.paused_: The desired pause state (true = halt operations, false = resume normal operation)

setSingletonContract(bytes32,address).details: Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Ensures single source of truth for protocol contracts.

setTreasury(address).details: Treasury receives protocol fees and serves as emergency fund holder. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the owner to transfer the ownership to `newOwner`.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrades the proxy's implementation to `newImplementation`. Emits a {Upgraded} event. Note: Passing in empty `data` skips the delegatecall to `newImplementation`.

addFunction(bytes4,address,bool).notice: Adds a function selector mapping to an implementation address

addFunctions(bytes4[],address,bool).notice: Adds multiple function selector mappings to an implementation

assetToKToken(address).notice: Gets the kToken address for a specific underlying asset

constructor.notice: Disables initializers to prevent implementation contract initialization

contractName().notice: Returns the human-readable name identifier for this contract type

contractVersion().notice: Returns the version identifier for this contract implementation

getAdapter(address,address).notice: Gets the adapter registered for a specific vault and asset

getAllVaults().notice: Gets all registered vaults in the protocol

getContractById(bytes32).notice: Retrieves a singleton contract address by identifier

getCoreContracts().notice: Retrieves core protocol contract addresses in one call

getHurdleRate(address).notice: Gets the hurdle rate for a specific asset

getMaxBurnPerBatch(address).notice: Gets the maximum redeem amount per batch for an asset

getMaxMintPerBatch(address).notice: Gets the maximum mint amount per batch for an asset

getVaultAssets(address).notice: Gets all assets managed by a specific vault

getVaultByAssetAndType(address,uint8).notice: Retrieves the primary vault for an asset-type combination

getVaultType(address).notice: Gets the classification type of a vault

getVaultsByAsset(address).notice: Gets all vaults that support a specific asset

grantInstitutionRole(address).notice: Grants institution role to enable privileged protocol access

grantManagerRole(address).notice: Grants manager role for vault adapter operations

grantRelayerRole(address).notice: Grants relayer role for external vault operations

grantVendorRole(address).notice: Grants vendor role for vendor management capabilities

isAdapterRegistered(address,address,addr.notice: Checks if a specific adapter is registered for a vault

isAdmin(address).notice: Checks if an address has admin privileges

isAsset(address).notice: Checks if an asset is supported by the protocol

isEmergencyAdmin(address).notice: Checks if an address has emergency admin privileges

isGuardian(address).notice: Checks if an address has guardian privileges

isInstitution(address).notice: Checks if an address is a qualified institution

isManager(address).notice: Checks if an address has manager privileges

isRelayer(address).notice: Checks if an address has relayer privileges

isVault(address).notice: Checks if a vault is registered in the protocol

isVendor(address).notice: Checks if an address has vendor privileges

registerAdapter(address,address,address).notice: Registers an external protocol adapter for a vault

registerAsset(string,string,address,byte.notice: Registers a new underlying asset in the protocol and deploys its corresponding kToken

registerVault(address,uint8,address).notice: Registers a new vault contract in the protocol's vault management system

removeAdapter(address,address,address).notice: Removes an adapter from a vault's registered adapter set

removeVault(address).notice: Removes a vault from the protocol registry

rescueAssets(address,address,uint256).notice: Emergency function to rescue accidentally sent assets (ETH or ERC20) from the contract

setAssetBatchLimits(address,uint256,uint.notice: Sets maximum mint and redeem amounts per batch for an asset

setHurdleRate(address,uint16).notice: Sets the hurdle rate for a specific asset

setPaused(bool).notice: Toggles the emergency pause state affecting all protocol operations in this contract

setSingletonContract(bytes32,address).notice: Registers a core singleton contract in the protocol

documentation.text: @notice Disables initializers to prevent implementation contract initialization

documentation.text:
@notice Authorize function modification
 @dev This allows modifying functions while keeping modules separate

@title kRegistry
 @notice Central configuration hub and contract registry for the KAM protocol ecosystem
 @dev This contract serves as the protocol's backbone for configuration management and access control. It provides
 five critical functions: (1) Singleton contract management - registers and tracks core protocol contracts like
 kMinter and kAssetRouter ensuring single source of truth, (2) Asset and kToken management - handles asset
 whitelisting, kToken deployment, and maintains bidirectional mappings between underlying assets and their
 corresponding kTokens, (3) Vault registry - manages vault registration, classification (DN, ALPHA, BETA, etc.),
 and routing logic to direct assets to appropriate vaults based on type and strategy, (4) Role-based access
 control - implements a hierarchical permission system with ADMIN, EMERGENCY_ADMIN, GUARDIAN, RELAYER, INSTITUTION,
 and VENDOR roles to enforce protocol security, (5) Adapter management - registers and tracks external protocol
 adapters per vault enabling yield strategy integrations. The registry uses upgradeable architecture with UUPS
 pattern and ERC-7201 namespaced storage to ensure future extensibility while maintaining state consistency.
